title: Sony's Xperia XZ2 Premium is finally being released in the UK
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**It’s been available in other regions for a while now, but Sony’s high-end
XZ2 Premium is finally coming to the UK very soon.**

The XZ2 Premium sits in the same series as the [Xperia
XZ2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz2) and [Xperia XZ2
Compact](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz2-compact) –
both of which were released earlier in the year – and adds a 4K HDR display
into the package.

Along with that display, which remains the only 4K screen you can get on a
phone in 2018, the XZ2 Premium also boasts a load of other flagships specs.
There’s a Snapdragon 845 inside, 6GB RAM and the same vibration system as the
Xperia XZ2. Other specs include a 3540 mAh battery, Qi wireless charging and
IP68 water-resistance.

**Related:[Best Smartphones](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-
smartphone-3431175)**

It’s also the first phone in the Xperia line to come with two cameras on the
back. There’s a monochrome 19-megapixel sensor sitting below a 19-megapixel
colour sensor, both of these work together to, hopefully, improve low-light
photography. Whether or not it performs better than the Xperia XZ2, which we
found slightly disappointing, remains to be seen.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Along with having a 5.8-inch 4K display, the phone can also shoot video in 4K
HDR. Again, it remains the only phone on the market that can actually do this.

When it launches, the Xperia XZ2 Premium will run Android 8.0 with Sony’s
fairly inoffensive skin on top. Thankfully we won’t have to wait too long for
it to be updated to [Android 9
Pie](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/android-pie), as that has been
confirmed for a November roll-out.

**Related:[Best Android phones](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-
android-phones-3438996)**

Obviously having a 4K screen on a phone is a feature to shout about, but
whether it actually makes a difference remains to be seen. At least there’s
plenty of content that you’ll be able to watch on it. Both Amazon Prime Video
and YouTube support 4K HDR content here, while Netflix will display in HDR
with 4K support coming later.

When it becomes available on August 31, the Sony Xperia XZ2 Premium will cost
£799. That puts it right in line with competitors like the [Samsung Galaxy
S9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-s9) and [iPhone
8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/iphone-8). It’ll be sold through
Amazon, along with EE.
